translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the One who Gives Alms Food
The Elder Story of the One who Gives Alms Food
“The One with Golden Skin, the Awakened One,
the Receiver of Offerings,
the One who has gone forth from the Best,
from the Forest, who has come to Emancipation.
I gave alms food of a bowlful,
to the Great Seer Siddhattha,
to the One who is Peaceful through Wisdom,
the Great Hero, the One who is Patient.
To the One who is without Footprints,
who is Emancipated, the Great People,
I have had a great profit,
in the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.
For ninety-four aeons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving alms food.
For eighty-seven aeons,
there were the ones named Mahāreṇu,
Endowed with the seven treasures,
seven times they were Kings of the Wheel-turning Monarchs.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six super-knowledges were experienced,
the Buddha’s instruction was accomplished.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bhikkhadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā bhikkhadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus it was said, and the Elder who Gives Alms Food, recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Bhikkhadāyaka is finished.
